channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2024040717
item.description:
Report X-2024040717

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER FOUND ON TOPSLIDE OF BOXLINE 2 CALLED IN LEAKER, DAMAGE INSPECTION, LEAKER. WHEN OPENING BOX FOUND UNDECLARED HAZMAT, SULFURIC ACID SOLUTION. ALSO DISCOVERED FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS, N.O.S. PGIII UN1993 AND SULFURIC ACID PG II UN2796.

item.title: Report X-2024040358
item.description:
Report X-2024040358

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: BEND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA wet. Upon inspection SDS was pulled to determine it was a hazardous material. Required gloves and eye protection were used to place hazmat in a leakproof hazmat bin. DescribePack: Failure was a large crack on the handle seam of the plastic bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Plastic bottle was packaged in a sealable bag preventing majority of liquid to leak out. Bottle was place upright to stop liquid from spilling out.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED IN PORTLAND WITH A WET SPOT ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX THE PACKAGE WAS PUT IN A HAZ TOTE AND TAKEN TO QA DescribePack: THE BLADER BAG IN THE BOX HAD A SMALL PUNCTURE IN THE BOTTOM OF THE BAG DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PUT IN A HAZ TOTE AND TAKEN TO QA

item.title: Report X-2024040215
item.description:
Report X-2024040215

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING ICE CREAM. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM OREGON USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 6029X7, DNA QUALITY, 1130 SHELLEY ST, SPRINGFIELD OR 97477-1916.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HAD A LOOSE CAP DURING SORTATION AND NO PLASTIC BAG ALLOWING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK. DescribePack: LEAK CAME FROM CLOSURE ABOUT THE SIZE OF A STANDARD GALLON MILK JUG DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA FOR INSPECTION.
